meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

main.docTitle: Prevention and Control of Disease Regulation

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Regulation, unless the context otherwise requires—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a police officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a health officer; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person appointed by the Director under section 3;

section.def: contact (傳染病接觸者) means any person who has been, or is likely to have been, exposed to the risk of contracting a specified infectious disease;
cross-boundary aircraft (跨境飛機) means an aircraft that is a cross-boundary conveyance;
cross-boundary conveyance (跨境運輸工具) means a conveyance that is engaged on a journey entering or leaving Hong Kong;
cross-boundary public vehicle (跨境公共車輛) means a public vehicle that is a cross-boundary conveyance;
cross-boundary vessel (跨境船隻) means a vessel that is a cross-boundary conveyance;
decontamination (除污) means to remove contamination;
disease control measure (疾病控制措施) includes cleansing, deratting, disinfection, disinsection and decontamination;
military hospital (軍方醫院) means a hospital of the Hong Kong Garrison;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a conveyance, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: its owner, charterer, master, pilot, commander or driver;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the person in charge of the conveyance; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a person who is acting as an agent of the owner, the charterer or the person in charge of the conveyance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a point of entry, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: its owner or lessee; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person who is in charge of the management of the point of entry or any part of it;

def.name: PointOfEntry
def.leadIn: point of entry (入境口岸) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an entry or exit passage for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: people entering or leaving Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: cross-boundary conveyances entering or leaving Hong Kong; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: articles being transported into or out of Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a place adjacent to the entry or exit passage in which any service is provided—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to people entering or leaving Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in respect of cross-boundary conveyances entering or leaving Hong Kong; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in respect of articles being transported into or out of Hong Kong;

section.def: prescribed fee (訂明費用), in relation to any purpose of this Regulation, means the fee prescribed for that purpose in Schedule 1;
quarantine anchorage (檢疫碇泊處) has the same meaning as in the Shipping and Port Control Regulations (Cap. 313 sub. leg. A);
specified infectious disease (指明傳染病) means a scheduled infectious disease or a disease caused by a scheduled infectious agent;
traveller (旅客) means a person arriving in or seeking to leave Hong Kong.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Appointment of appointed persons

subsection.leadIn: The Director may appoint—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Auxiliary Medical Service; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the Civil Aid Service; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a member of the Immigration Service established by section 3 of the Immigration Service Ordinance (Cap. 331) or any other public officer,

subsection.content: An appointment under subsection (1) may be made either by rank or office as specified by the Director.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Duty of medical practitioners to notify Director

subsection.content: If a medical practitioner has reason to suspect the existence of a case of a scheduled infectious disease, whether or not the person infected has died, he shall notify the Director immediately.
A notification under subsection (1) must be in a form specified by the Director and be signed by the medical practitioner.
If after notifying the Director, the medical practitioner verifies either that the scheduled infectious disease existed or that it did not exist, he shall immediately notify the Director.

A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (3) or knowingly gives the Director any information that is false in a material particular commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Medical practitioners to give information as required by health officers

subsection.content: A health officer may, for the purpose of facilitating the investigation of a case or suspected case of a specified infectious disease, require a medical practitioner to give to the health officer any information about the case as the health officer may require.
A medical practitioner shall comply with a requirement made under subsection (1).

A person who contravenes subsection (2) or knowingly gives to a health officer any information that is false in a material particular commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Duty of operators of cross-boundary conveyances to notify health officer

subsection.leadIn: If the operator of a cross-boundary aircraft, cross-boundary vessel or cross-boundary public vehicle has reason to suspect that there exists on board the aircraft, vessel or public vehicle—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a case or source of a specified infectious disease; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a case or source of contamination,

subsection.continued: he shall notify a health officer immediately.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Operators to give information as required by health officers

subsection.leadIn: If a health officer has reason to suspect that there exists or existed in a point of entry or on board a cross-boundary conveyance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a case or source of an infectious disease; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a case or source of contamination,

subsection.continued: the health officer may require the operator of the point of entry or cross-boundary conveyance to give to the health officer any information about the case or source as the health officer may require.

subsection.content: An operator shall comply with a requirement made under subsection (1).

A person who contravenes subsection (2) or knowingly gives to a health officer any information that is false in a material particular commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Travellers to give information as required by health officers

subsection.content: A health officer may, for the purpose of preventing the occurrence or spread of an infectious disease or contamination, require a traveller to give to the health officer any information required by the health officer.
A traveller shall comply with a requirement made under subsection (1).

A person who contravenes subsection (2) or knowingly gives to a health officer any information that is false in a material particular commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Defence to charges under section 5, 7 or 8
section.content: It is a defence to a charge under section 5, 7 or 8 to prove that the information required to be given was not within the knowledge of the person charged and could not reasonably have been ascertained by him.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Disease Prevention, Medical Surveillance, Examination and Test

section.name: s10
section.heading: Power of entry and examination

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), if a health officer has reason to suspect that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a contact or a person infected with a specified infectious disease is present in a place;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a case or suspected case of a specified infectious disease is connected with a place;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: there is a leakage of a scheduled infectious agent in a laboratory that may pose a public health risk; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a source of a specified infectious disease exists in a place other than a laboratory,

subsection.continued: the health officer may enter the place or laboratory, or, where necessary, break into the place or laboratory in the presence of a police officer.

subsection.leadIn: On entering a place or laboratory under this section, a health officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: ascertain whether a contact or a person infected with a specified infectious disease is present in that place;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there is a dead body in the place, examine the dead body for the purpose of ascertaining whether the body is infected with a specified infectious disease;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: seize any article or part of an article for examination or testing if he has reason to suspect that the article is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a source of a specified infectious disease; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: connected with a case or suspected case of a specified infectious disease; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: take photographs or make any audio or video recording.

subsection.leadIn: Unless authorized by a warrant issued under subsection (4), a health officer shall not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter any residential premises without the permission of its occupier or a person appearing to him to be in charge of the premises; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: break into any residential premises.

subsection.leadIn: A magistrate may issue a warrant authorizing any health officer to enter or break into any premises if the magistrate is satisfied by information on oath by a health officer that admission into the premises has been refused and that the premises is residential premises and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the health officer has reason to suspect that a contact or a person infected with a specified infectious disease is present on the premises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the health officer has reason to suspect that a case or suspected case of a specified infectious disease is connected with the premises; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the health officer has reason to suspect that a source of a specified infectious disease exists on the premises.

subsection.content: The power conferred by a warrant issued under subsection (4) on a health officer may be exercised by any health officer either alone or with the assistance of other persons.

def.name: ResidentialPremises
def.leadIn: In this section, residential premises (住用處所) means a place or part of a place that is used wholly or principally for dwelling purposes and constitutes a separate household unit, but does not include the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a home for the aged, home for persons with disabilities, child care centre, convalescent centre or a similar establishment; (12 of 2011 s. 48)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a point of entry;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a cross-boundary conveyance; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a place of quarantine or isolation.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Maintaining points of entry, cross-boundary aircrafts, vessels or public vehicles in sanitary condition

subsection.content: The operator of a point of entry or a cross-boundary aircraft, cross-boundary vessel or cross-boundary public vehicle shall ensure, as far as practicable, that the point of entry or cross-boundary aircraft, cross-boundary vessel or cross-boundary public vehicle is maintained in a sanitary condition.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Health officers may enter and inspect points of entry and cross-boundary conveyances

subsection.leadIn: A health officer may enter, without a warrant, a point of entry or a cross-boundary conveyance for the purpose of inspecting whether the point of entry, the cross-boundary conveyance or any article in or carried in or on it—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is maintained in a sanitary condition; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is kept free from sources of an infectious disease or contamination.

subsection.leadIn: On entering a point of entry or a cross-boundary conveyance under subsection (1), a health officer may, for the purpose of ascertaining the sanitary condition of the point of entry or cross-boundary conveyance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: seize any article or part of an article for examination or testing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: place any device in the point of entry or in or on the cross-boundary conveyance for the collection of any sample; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: take photographs or make any audio or video recording.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Health officers may inspect journals, etc. of points of entry or cross-boundary conveyances
section.leadIn: A health officer may, for the purpose of monitoring or investigating any matter concerning a case or source of an infectious disease or contamination, inspect and make a copy of any journal, logbook or record kept in respect of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a point of entry; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a cross-boundary conveyance.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Import of human corpse, etc.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not, without a permit in writing from the Director, knowingly import into Hong Kong—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a human corpse or any part of a human corpse;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an infectious agent;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any human or animal tissue, or tissue fluid, or any part of a human or animal body, that the person has reason to suspect contains an infectious agent; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any excreta, secretion, blood, or blood component, that the person has reason to suspect contains an infectious agent.

subsection.content: The Director may specify any condition that he considers appropriate in a permit referred to in subsection (1).
A person to whom a permit is issued shall comply with any condition specified under subsection (2).
A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 2 months.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Medical surveillance, examination or test of contacts or infected or contaminated persons

subsection.content: If a health officer has reason to suspect that a person is a contact or is infected with a specified infectious disease or is contaminated, the health officer may subject the person to medical surveillance or a medical examination or a test, which must not be more intrusive or invasive than is necessary for ascertaining the person’s health condition.
A health officer may specify conditions to be observed by the person.
A person who fails to observe any condition specified under subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Medical examination of persons arrested
section.content: A health officer may subject a person arrested under section 5 of the Ordinance to a medical examination or a test, which must not be more intrusive or invasive than is necessary for ascertaining the person’s health condition.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: designated centre (指定中心) means a hospital, clinic, health care centre or a similar establishment designated by the Director as a designated centre under section 18;
designated disease (指定疾病) means a specified infectious disease specified in column 2 of Part 1 of Schedule 1.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Designation of designated centres

subsection.leadIn: The Director may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: designate any hospital, clinic, health care centre or similar establishment as a designated centre; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify any condition that he considers appropriate in respect of the designation.

subsection.content: The Director shall notify in the Gazette a designation under subsection (1).
A notification under subsection (2) is not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Vaccination and prophylaxis

subsection.content: A health officer may, for the purpose of preventing the occurrence or spread of an infectious disease, require a traveller at a point of entry to produce for inspection a certificate of vaccination or prophylaxis in the form described as the “Model International Certificate of Vaccination or Prophylaxis” in the International Health Regulations, certifying that the traveller has been vaccinated or has received prophylaxis against a designated disease in accordance with the International Health Regulations.
For the purposes of subsection (1), a health officer may accept a certificate that is substantially in accordance with the form referred to in that subsection.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Certification of vaccination or prophylaxis by medical practitioners

subsection.leadIn: A medical practitioner who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: practises in a designated centre; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has administered, or supervised the administration of, vaccination or prophylaxis against a designated disease, in the centre, to a person, in accordance with the International Health Regulations,

subsection.continued: may issue a certificate of vaccination or prophylaxis certifying the matters referred to in paragraph (b).

subsection.leadIn: Any person who, not being a person referred to in subsection (1) or section 21, issues a certificate of vaccination or prophylaxis—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: containing a representation that it is issued pursuant to the International Health Regulations; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: containing any reference to or a diagram or a picture that is related to WHO or a reference to the International Health Regulations,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Administration and certification of vaccination or prophylaxis by health officers on payment of fees
section.leadIn: A health officer may, on request and on the payment of the prescribed fee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: administer to a person vaccination or prophylaxis against a designated disease, in accordance with the International Health Regulations; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue a certificate of vaccination or prophylaxis certifying the matters referred to in paragraph (a).

part.name: P5
part.heading: Quarantine and Isolation

section.name: s22
section.heading: Quarantine of contacts

subsection.leadIn: If a health officer has reason to believe that a person is a contact, the health officer may, by order in writing, place the person under quarantine until a health officer considers that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is not infectious; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the quarantine can be replaced by medical surveillance.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), any of the following circumstances are regarded as a reason for a health officer to believe that a traveller is a contact—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a health officer has reason to believe that the traveller has not been vaccinated or has not received prophylaxis against a designated disease (whether or not a certificate of vaccination or prophylaxis has been produced for inspection under section 19(1));

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a health officer has reason to believe that the vaccination or prophylaxis that the traveller has received is not effective (whether or not a certificate of vaccination or prophylaxis has been produced for inspection under section 19(1)).

subsection.leadIn: An order made under subsection (1) must specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reason for quarantine; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the terms of quarantine. (L.N. 35 of 2022)

subsection.content: A person in respect of whom an order is made by a health officer under subsection (1) must not leave the place in which the person is placed under quarantine except in compliance with the terms of quarantine specified in the order. (L.N. 35 of 2022)
A person in respect of whom an order is made by a health officer under subsection (1) must comply with the order and the terms of quarantine specified in the order. (L.N. 35 of 2022)
A person who contravenes subsection (4) or (5) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (L.N. 35 of 2022)

section.name: s23
section.heading: Isolation of infected persons

subsection.leadIn: If a health officer has reason to believe that a person is infected with a specified infectious disease, the health officer may, by order in writing, place the person under isolation until a health officer considers that— (L.N. 35 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is not infectious; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the isolation can be replaced by medical surveillance.

subsection.leadIn: An order made under subsection (1) must specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reason for isolation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the terms of isolation. (L.N. 35 of 2022)

subsection.content: A person in respect of whom an order is made by a health officer under subsection (1) must not leave the place in which the person is placed under isolation except in compliance with the terms of isolation specified in the order. (L.N. 35 of 2022)
A person in respect of whom an order is made by a health officer under subsection (1) must comply with the order and the terms of isolation specified in the order. (L.N. 35 of 2022)
A person who contravenes subsection (3) or (4) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (L.N. 35 of 2022)

section.name: s24
section.heading: Isolation of infected articles

subsection.content: If a health officer has reason to believe that an article is infected with a specified infectious disease, he may, by order in writing, place the article under isolation.

subsection.leadIn: A health officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: send an article to any place for the purpose of placing the article under isolation in that place; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: direct the owner, or the person in control or possession, of an article to surrender the article to a health officer for the purpose of placing the article under isolation. (L.N. 35 of 2022)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: A person must not obstruct a health officer in sending an article under subsection (2)(a). (L.N. 35 of 2022)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.content: A person must comply with a direction given under subsection (2)(b). (L.N. 35 of 2022)
An article that is placed under isolation may be detained at any place appointed by a health officer for such period and subject to such conditions as he may specify.
A person shall not remove an article that is placed under isolation from the place where it is isolated without the permission of a health officer.
A person who contravenes subsection (2A), (2B) or (4) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (L.N. 35 of 2022)

section.name: s25
section.heading: Power to order places to be isolated

subsection.content: Where the Director considers it necessary for the prevention of the spread of a specified infectious disease, he may, by order in writing, place any place under isolation.

subsection.leadIn: An isolation order may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provide for the complete isolation of the place that is the subject of the order; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide for such degree of isolation of the place, and subject the place to such conditions or limitations, as the Director considers sufficient to prevent the spread of the disease concerned.

subsection.content: An isolation order may be issued in such form or in such manner as, having regard to the circumstances, the Director considers best suited to bring the terms of such order to the notice of the public.
A health officer may direct a person to leave a place that is to be placed under isolation. (L.N. 35 of 2022)
A person who fails to comply with a direction given under subsection (4) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (L.N. 35 of 2022)

part.crossHeading: General Provisions in relation to Quarantine and Isolation

section.name: s27
section.heading: Power to remove and detain persons for quarantine and isolation

subsection.leadIn: To place a person under quarantine or isolation, a health officer, a person appointed under section 3, or a public officer authorized by the Director for the purposes of this section (authorized officer) may— (L.N. 35 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: remove the person to a place in which the person is to be quarantined or isolated;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: detain the person at a place of quarantine or isolation; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subject the person to such conditions as the health officer, the person appointed or the authorized officer may specify. (L.N. 35 of 2022)

subsection.content: A person must not obstruct a health officer, a person appointed under section 3 or an authorized officer in the exercise of a power under this section. (L.N. 35 of 2022)
A person must comply with any condition to which the person is subject under subsection (1)(c). (L.N. 35 of 2022)
A person who contravenes subsection (2) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (L.N. 35 of 2022)

section.name: s28
section.heading: Escape from quarantine or isolation in hospitals or other facilities

subsection.leadIn: If a person who is placed under quarantine or isolation in a hospital, home for the aged, home for persons with disabilities, child care centre, convalescent centre or similar facility (establishment) escapes, the person may be— (12 of 2011 s. 49; L.N. 35 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: stopped and detained by any member of the staff of the establishment from which the person escaped;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the establishment from which the person escaped; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any other place authorized by a health officer; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: detained in the establishment or place.

subsection.content: A person must not obstruct a member of the staff of an establishment in the exercise of a power under this section.
A person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Entry and exit restrictions

subsection.leadIn: A person other than a health officer shall not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter or leave a place in which another person is placed under quarantine or isolation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: enter or leave a place that is placed under isolation,

subsection.continued: without a written permission given under section 31.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Restrictions on bringing articles into or taking articles out of places placed under isolation

subsection.content: A person other than a health officer shall not bring any article into or take any article out of a place that is placed under isolation without a written permission given under section 31.
A health officer may seize any article that is brought into or taken out of a place in contravention of subsection (1).
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (L.N. 35 of 2022)

section.name: s31
section.heading: General permission in respect of sections 29 and 30
section.content: A health officer may give written permission to any person or persons of any class or category specified in the permission to do any act described in sections 29(2)(a) and (b) and 30(1), subject to such exceptions, conditions or restrictions as are specified in the permission.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Persons not to expose others to infection

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not, knowing that he is a contact or is infected with a specified infectious disease, expose other persons to the risk of infection—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: by the person’s presence or conduct in—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any public conveyance; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any street, public place, place of entertainment or assembly, club or hotel; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by carrying on any trade, business or occupation.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Subsection (1)(a) does not apply to the presence of a person in respect of whom an order is made by a health officer under section 22(1) or 23(1) in any place or public conveyance if such presence is permitted under the terms specified in the order. (L.N. 35 of 2022)

A person who has the care of any person whom the first mentioned has reason to believe is a contact or is infected with a specified infectious disease shall make every reasonable endeavour to prevent the person from doing any act described in subsection (1).
A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (L.N. 35 of 2022)

section.name: s33
section.heading: Examination of dead bodies
section.content: If a health officer has reason to believe that the body of a deceased person is infected with a specified infectious disease, a health officer may carry out a post-mortem examination on the body, and for that purpose, remove the body to a mortuary or other suitable place.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Disposal of infected dead bodies

subsection.leadIn: If a health officer has reason to believe that the body of a deceased person is infected with a specified infectious disease, the health officer may issue directions concerning any or all of the following matters—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the disease control measures to be carried out in respect of the body;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the method of disposal of the body;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the place of burial or cremation of the body;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the time, route and method of removing the body to the place of burial or cremation.

subsection.content: A health officer may cause the body to be disposed of if no other person undertakes its disposal.
A person who undertakes the disposal of the body shall comply with any direction issued by a health officer under subsection (1).
A person who contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s35
section.heading: No infected dead body to be dealt with otherwise

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not deposit or cause to be deposited the body of a deceased person that a health officer has reason to believe is infected with a specified infectious disease in a place other than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a place of burial or cremation directed by a health officer under section 34;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a mortuary (whether or not situated within the precincts of any hospital or similar institution) that is maintained or controlled by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Government;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a public hospital as defined in section 2(1) of the Hospital Authority Ordinance (Cap. 113); (34 of 2018 s. 192)
a hospital within the meaning of the Private Healthcare Facilities Ordinance (Cap. 633) for which a licence under that Ordinance is in force; (34 of 2018 s. 192 and E.R. 5 of 2018)

a scheduled nursing home within the meaning of the Private Healthcare Facilities Ordinance (Cap. 633) for which an exemption granted under section 128 of that Ordinance is in force; or (34 of 2018 s. 192 and E.R. 5 of 2018)
a nursing home within the meaning of the Residential Care Homes (Elderly Persons) Ordinance (Cap. 459) for which a licence under that Ordinance is in force; (34 of 2018 s. 192)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a mortuary situated within the precincts of a military hospital; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a funeral parlour that is licensed under section 4 of the Funeral Parlours Regulation (Cap. 132 sub. leg. AD).

subsection.content: A person who knowingly contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Persons who die on cross-boundary conveyances

subsection.content: If a person dies on a cross-boundary aircraft, cross-boundary vessel or cross-boundary public vehicle, its operator shall notify a health officer immediately.

The operator of a cross-boundary aircraft, cross-boundary vessel or cross-boundary public vehicle shall comply with any directions as the health officer may give in respect of the disposal of the body.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Order to carry out disease control measures in respect of points of entry or premises

subsection.leadIn: If a health officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: finds that a point of entry is in an insanitary condition; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has reason to believe that there exists or existed on any premises a case or source of a specified infectious disease,

subsection.continued: the health officer may, by an order in writing served on the appropriate person referred to in subsection (2), require a disease control measure specified in the order to be carried out in respect of the point of entry or premises to the satisfaction of a health officer within the time specified in the order.

subsection.leadIn: The appropriate person referred to in subsection (1) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a point of entry, its operator; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of other premises, its owner or occupier.

subsection.content: A health officer may, for the purpose of carrying out a disease control measure required to be carried out under subsection (1), close the premises or remove any person from it.

subsection.leadIn: Except with the permission of a health officer, a person other than a health officer shall not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter or occupy; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: bring any article into or take any article out of,

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (4) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Order to carry out disease control measures in respect of conveyances

subsection.leadIn: If a health officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has reason to believe that there exists or existed on board a conveyance a case or source of a specified infectious disease; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: finds that a cross-boundary conveyance is in an insanitary condition or is contaminated,

subsection.continued: the health officer may, by order in writing served on the operator of the conveyance, require a disease control measure specified in the order to be carried out in respect of the conveyance to the satisfaction of a health officer within the time specified in the order.

subsection.content: A health officer may, for the purpose of carrying out a disease control measure required to be carried out under subsection (1), stop, detain or close the conveyance or remove any person from it.

subsection.leadIn: Except with the permission of a health officer, a person other than a health officer shall not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: board or remain in; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: bring any article into or take any article out of,

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Wells

subsection.content: If a health officer is of the opinion that it is necessary to do so for the purpose of preventing the introduction or spread of a specified infectious disease, the health officer may, by an order in writing served on the owner of a well, require the well to be filled up, cleansed or disinfected to the satisfaction of a health officer within the time specified in the order.

Except with the permission of a health officer, a person other than a health officer shall not draw water from a well in respect of which an order is made under subsection (1) before the well is filled up, cleansed or disinfected as required by the order.
A person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Enforcement of orders made under section 37, 38 or 39

subsection.leadIn: Where an order made under section 37, 38 or 39 is not complied with within the time specified in the order, a health officer or any person authorized by that officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter or board, or where necessary, break into in the presence of a police officer, the point of entry, other premises or conveyance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: carry out the disease control measures required by the order.

subsection.leadIn: The costs incurred under subsection (1) may be recovered from the following persons as a debt due to the Government—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of an order made under section 37, the operator of the point of entry or the owner or the occupier of other premises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an order made under section 38, the operator of the conveyance; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of an order made under section 39, the owner of the well.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Disinfection and destruction of articles

subsection.leadIn: If a health officer has reason to believe that an article is, or may have been, infected with a specified infectious disease, the health officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: order a disease control measure to be carried out in respect of the article; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: except where the article is a conveyance, destroy the article.

subsection.leadIn: The costs incurred under subsection (1) may be recovered from the following persons as a debt due to the Government—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the article is a conveyance, its operator; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of other articles, the owner or the person who has possession or control of the articles.

part.name: P8
part.heading: Control of Laboratory’s Handling of Scheduled Infectious Agents

section.name: s42
section.heading: Requirement to surrender scheduled infectious agents

subsection.leadIn: The Director may require the owner or the person in charge of a laboratory to surrender a scheduled infectious agent under his control or possession for disposal by the Director if, having regard to the circumstances, the Director has reason to believe that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the laboratory does not have sufficient facilities and equipment to handle the scheduled infectious agent;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person handling the agent in the laboratory does not have the necessary competency to do so; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the agent is handled by the laboratory in a manner that may pose a public health risk.

subsection.content: The owner or the person in charge of the laboratory shall comply with the requirement made under subsection (1).
A person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Laboratory shall notify Director of cases of leakage of scheduled infectious agents

subsection.content: If it comes to the knowledge of the owner or the person in charge of a laboratory that there is a leakage of a scheduled infectious agent in the laboratory that may pose a public health risk, the owner or that person shall notify the Director immediately.
The owner or the person in charge of the laboratory shall give to the Director any information that is required by a health officer to facilitate the investigation of the leakage.

A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) or knowingly gives any information that is false in a material particular commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

part.name: P9
part.heading: Declaration and Certification in respect of Cross-boundary Conveyances

section.name: s44
section.heading: Submission of Maritime Declaration of Health

subsection.content: The operator of a cross-boundary vessel that enters the waters of Hong Kong shall submit to a health officer a declaration, in the form described as the “Model of Maritime Declaration of Health” in the International Health Regulations, declaring the matters specified in the form, signed by the operator and, if a surgeon is carried, counter-signed by the surgeon.
The person who signs or counter-signs the declaration shall ensure that the information contained in the declaration is not false in any material particular.

subsection.leadIn: A health officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: waive the requirement to submit the declaration under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accept for the purposes of subsection (1) a declaration that is substantially in accordance with the form referred to in that subsection.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), a person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.
A person who knowingly contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Ship Sanitation Control Exemption Certificate and Ship Sanitation Control Certificate

subsection.leadIn: The operator of a cross-boundary vessel that enters the waters of Hong Kong shall produce for inspection by a health officer a certificate that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in accordance with the form described as the “Model Ship Sanitation Control Exemption Certificate/Ship Sanitation Control Certificate” in the International Health Regulations; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issued in respect of the vessel by a port of a State Party to the International Health Regulations being authorized to issue the certificate.

subsection.leadIn: A health officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: waive the requirement to submit the certificate under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accept for the purposes of subsection (1) a certificate that is substantially in accordance with the form referred to in that subsection.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), a person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s46
section.heading: Issue of Ship Sanitation Control Exemption Certificate by health officer

subsection.content: A health officer may, on the payment of the prescribed fee, issue a Ship Sanitation Control Exemption Certificate, in a form specified by the Director, in respect of a cross-boundary vessel certifying the matters specified in the form.

subsection.leadIn: A health officer may not issue a certificate in respect of a cross-boundary vessel unless he is satisfied that the vessel is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in a sanitary condition; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: free from any evidence of infection or contamination.

section.name: s47
section.heading: Issue of Ship Sanitation Control Certificate by health officer

subsection.content: A health officer may, on the payment of the prescribed fee, issue a Ship Sanitation Control Certificate, in a form specified by the Director, in respect of a cross-boundary vessel certifying the matters specified in the form.

If a health officer has specified a disease control measure to be carried out in respect of the vessel, a health officer may state in the certificate that the measure has or has not been carried out to the satisfaction of a health officer.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Endorsement on certificates
section.leadIn: A health officer may endorse on a certificate that is produced for inspection under section 45(1) matters concerning any or all of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether or not any evidence of infection or contamination was found on the vessel in respect of which the certificate was issued;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if such evidence was found on the vessel, a description of the evidence;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the sanitariness of the vessel;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: whether any disease control measure has been or is to be carried out in respect of the vessel;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if a certificate (the new certificate) has been issued under section 47 in respect of the vessel, a statement declaring that the certificate is superseded by the new certificate.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Submission of Health Part of Aircraft General Declaration

subsection.content: The operator of a cross-boundary aircraft shall submit to a health officer a declaration, in the form described as the “Health Part of the Aircraft General Declaration” in the International Health Regulations, declaring the matters specified in the form.
The person who signs or counter-signs the declaration shall ensure that the information contained in the declaration is not false in a material particular.

subsection.leadIn: A health officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: waive the requirement to submit the declaration under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accept for the purposes of subsection (1) a declaration that is substantially in accordance with the form referred to in that subsection.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), a person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.
A person who knowingly contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Cross-boundary vessels to show quarantine signals

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), an operator of a cross-boundary vessel that enters the waters of Hong Kong shall ensure that the appropriate quarantine signal set out in Schedule 2 is shown on the vessel.
The operator of a cross-boundary vessel shall ensure that the quarantine signal is not lowered until the vessel has been granted free pratique.

A cross-boundary vessel that is on a voyage to any place outside Hong Kong may, with the permission of a health officer, proceed with its voyage or tranship its passengers for the purpose of completing such voyage without showing any quarantine signal.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 2 months.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Cross-boundary vessels without free pratique required to proceed to quarantine anchorage

subsection.content: An operator of a cross-boundary vessel that enters the waters of Hong Kong shall ensure that the vessel proceeds immediately to a quarantine anchorage or other anchorage as permitted by a health officer, unless the vessel has been granted free pratique.
A health officer may permit a cross-boundary vessel that has not been granted free pratique to proceed to an anchorage that is not a quarantine anchorage.

subsection.leadIn: The operator of a cross-boundary vessel that is in a quarantine anchorage or in an anchorage referred to in subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall not remove the vessel from there until it is released with the permission of a health officer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall move the vessel to any part of the anchorage as and when required by the Director of Marine.

subsection.content: Despite subsection (3), the vessel may be removed from the quarantine anchorage because of stress of weather, but the operator shall move the vessel back to the quarantine anchorage immediately after such stress of weather subsides.
A person who contravenes subsection (1), (3) or (4) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 2 months.

section.name: s52
section.heading: No disembarking of any person and unloading of articles without free pratique

subsection.content: An operator of a cross-boundary vessel that enters the waters of Hong Kong shall ensure that no person is disembarked and no article is unloaded from the vessel, unless permitted by a health officer or the vessel has been granted free pratique.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s53
section.heading: Cross-boundary vessels shall not be approached without permission

subsection.content: Where a cross-boundary vessel is showing a quarantine signal, except with the permission of a health officer, a person other than a health officer shall not approach within 30 m of the vessel or receive or take any person or article, directly or indirectly, from the vessel or from any person on board the vessel.
A person who boards the vessel with the permission of a health officer shall observe such precautions as the health officer may require.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 2 months.

section.name: s54
section.heading: Free pratique
section.content: A health officer may grant free pratique in respect of a cross-boundary vessel that enters the waters of Hong Kong if, in his opinion, the vessel appears to be in a sanitary condition.

part.name: P11
part.heading: Regulation on Landing and Departure of Cross-boundary Aircrafts

section.name: s55
section.heading: Restrictions on landing and departure of cross-boundary aircrafts

subsection.leadIn: If a health officer has reason to believe that there exists or existed on board a cross-boundary aircraft a case or source of a specified infectious disease or a case or source of contamination, that officer may direct the Director-General of Civil Aviation to prohibit the aircraft from—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: landing at any aerodrome other than an aerodrome or a particular part of an aerodrome designated by a health officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: leaving such aerodrome or such part of aerodrome except with the permission of a health officer; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: embarking or disembarking any person or loading or unloading any article except with the permission of a health officer.

subsection.content: If a prohibition imposed pursuant to subsection (1)(a) or (b) is contravened, the operator of the aircraft concerned commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 2 months.

If a prohibition imposed pursuant to subsection (1)(c) is contravened, the operator of the aircraft concerned commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

part.name: P12
part.heading: Control Measures in respect of Specified Diseases

section.name: s56
section.heading: Specified diseases
section.leadIn: In this Part, specified disease (指明疾病) means any of the following scheduled infectious diseases—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome;

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: Middle East Respiratory Syndrome; (L.N. 143 of 2012; L.N. 103 of 2013)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Novel influenza A infection; (L.N. 22 of 2014; L.N. 118 of 2014)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Extensively Drug-Resistant Tuberculosis; (L.N. 118 of 2014)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: Plague; (L.N. 118 of 2014)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: Smallpox; (L.N. 118 of 2014; L.N. 4 of 2020)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: Viral haemorrhagic fever; (L.N. 118 of 2014; L.N. 4 of 2020)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19); (L.N. 47 of 2020; L.N. 134 of 2022)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: Monkeypox. (L.N. 134 of 2022)

section.name: s57
section.heading: Persons prohibited from leaving Hong Kong without written permission of health officers

subsection.leadIn: If a health officer has reason to believe that a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is suffering from a specified disease; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has been exposed to the risk of infection of a specified disease,

subsection.continued: a health officer may, by order in writing, prohibit the person from leaving Hong Kong without the written permission of a health officer during a period specified in the order.

subsection.content: A health officer shall serve a copy of the order on the subject of the order, either personally or by post, but whether or not it is served, the order comes into force immediately on being made.
The subject of the order shall not leave Hong Kong without the written permission of a health officer during the period specified in the order.
A health officer may attach any condition in writing as he considers appropriate to the permission referred to in subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: knowingly contravenes subsection (3); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fails to comply with a condition attached under subsection (4),

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s58
section.heading: Power to stop and detain persons seeking to leave Hong Kong in contravention of section 57(3)
section.leadIn: If a person seeks to leave Hong Kong in contravention of section 57(3), an appointed person may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: stop and detain the person in a point of entry; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: remove the person to and detain the person in another place,

section.continued: so that a health officer may subject the person to a medical examination or a test.

section.name: s59
section.heading: Measuring temperature of travellers

subsection.content: As a measure for preventing the introduction into and transmission from Hong Kong of a specified disease, any person authorized by the Director for the purpose of this subsection may take the body temperature of a traveller who is at a point of entry.
An authorized person may stop and detain any traveller until the traveller’s body temperature can be taken under subsection (1).

section.name: s60
section.heading: Operators to give assistance to health officers

subsection.content: An operator of a point of entry or a cross-boundary conveyance shall give such reasonable assistance as may be required by a health officer in the execution of the health officer’s functions under this Regulation.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 2 months.

section.name: s61
section.heading: Exercise of health officer’s powers
section.content: Any act or thing that may be done by a health officer under a power given by this Regulation may be done by a person acting under the direction of a health officer.

part.name: P1

schedule.name: sch2
schedule.heading: Quarantine Signals
schedule.crossHeading: Signals to be Shown by Cross-boundary Vessels

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: Every cross-boundary vessel that has not been granted free pratique shall show the following signals (whichever is appropriate)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Flag Signal Q: meaning “my ship is healthy and I request free pratique”;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the International Code Signal “Q.Q.”: meaning “I require health clearance”; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the International Code Signal “Z.V.”: meaning “I declare I have been in an infected area during the last 30 days”; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by night, during the entire time between sunset and sunrise, but only when the vessel is within the waters of Hong Kong, a signal comprising a red light over a white light, the lights being not more than 2 m apart, and meaning “I have not free pratique”.

section.name: s2
section.content: The day signal shall be shown at the vessel’s masthead or other conspicuous place where it can be best seen.

section.name: s3
section.content: The night signal shall be shown at the vessel’s peak or other conspicuous place where it can be best seen.
